entry.title: Join the immigrant rights movement on Friday, December 18 at 7...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

Join the immigrant rights movement on Friday, December 18 at 7 p.m. for a premiere virtual screening of “The Facility.”

“The Facility” is a short documentary film chronicling the lived experiences of immigrants being held at the GEO detention facility in Aurora, Colorado. This film addresses the personal loss and consequences caused by for-profit detention and the federal government's broken immigration policies. Legal and medical experts highlight horrific abuses including ...

Continue Reading

FRI, DEC 18 AT 7:00 PM MST

"The Facility" Premiere Screening

Online EventCauses · 623 people

entry.title: "For decades, northwest Aurora has been home to a large...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

"For decades, northwest Aurora has been home to a large immigrant detention facility formally known as the Aurora Contract Detention Facility. Run by private prison company GEO Group through a contract with Immigration and Customs Enforcement, the detention center holds a wide range of immigrant detainees, including asylum seekers, undocumented immigrants with and without criminal convictions, and documented immigrants who are potentially subject to deportation because of cri...minal convictions.

The movie, titled "The Facility," highlights the pain experienced by families who lose a loved one to immigrant detention, which often leads to deportation. "I was just really overwhelmed by the stories I was hearing," says Flood, who lived in the encampment with families whose husbands, fathers and sons were detained across the street at the detention facility.

Flood hopes that the film will help push policymakers toward abolishing for-profit immigrant detention, something that activists in Colorado have been demanding for years. "I see the reflection of my own history in a lot of what’s going on in our immigration system and the way that it’s sort of set up not to serve the public interest or public safety, but to make an extraordinary profit," says Flood, who is Black.

Flood's favorite character in the film is Raul Medina Perez, a 29-year-old who has called the United States home since he came here at the age of five. ICE detained Medina Perez in 2019, and the film shows his eventual release after eleven months in ICE detention and the reunification with his family outside the detention center.

"I feel like I really connected with Raul because we’re about the same age," says Flood. "He was so relatable. It just made it all the more horrific to me to hear the things that he had gone through in there, just because I could put myself in his shoes."

See MoreFilmmaker Jeremy Flood moved into the encampment outside the Aurora center.

westword.com

"The Facility" Documents Realities of ICE Detention in Colorado

Filmmaker Jeremy Flood moved into the encampment outside the Aurora center.Filmmaker Jeremy Flood moved into the encampment outside the Aurora center.

entry.title: "A recent report that stated immigration is not a top...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

"A recent report that stated immigration is not a top priority for the incoming Biden administration caused whiplash among some activists who were reminded of the oft-criticized approach of the Obama administration, while others said they will wait and see how the administration conducts itself in its early days with respect to the high-stakes issue.

Citing a person close to the transition, the NPR report said the view among many in Biden-world is that immigration activists have become too "adversarial," with policy demands that make Biden's team "uncomfortable."

A recent report that stated immigration is not a top priority for the incoming Biden administration caused whiplash among some activists, who were reminded of the oft-criticized approach of the Obama administration.

newsweek.com

In Biden commitment to immigration, activists see echoes of concerns with Obama

entry.title: "We were able to win in court against humanitarian aid...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

"We were able to win in court against humanitarian aid being criminalized, but migration is still being criminalized. That’s the core of it, and that’s the root problem. Biden will likely stop wall construction, but I think under both Democrats and Republicans, we’ve seen a gradual increase in border militarization."

https://www.thenation.com/a…/society/no-more-deaths-arizona/

Join us in expressing and imagining a world without cages. The urgency to Free Them All has never been greater. Together we've been sounding the alarm and demanding action month on month, day by day - hustling for that world where everyone can come back to the table.

WE HEARD FROM YOU, our community, a yearning to be invited into believing and imagining the next level of being human - a world we can touch and live into, one without jails, prisons and detention. To bring our souls, hearts, minds and bodies in this future world we've invited healers, speakers, poets and musicians.

Join us to Free Them All, join us in collectively getting free. There'll be creative calls to action throughout the night so be ready to participate!

entry.title: "In September, the House Oversight Committee found that ICE...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

"In September, the House Oversight Committee found that ICE detainees died after receiving inadequate medical care and that jail workers “falsified records to cover up” issues. That same month, a separate committee report issued by the House Homeland Security Committee found that ICE detainees are often given deficient medical care and that detention centers use segregation as a threat against immigrants [...]

The draft report obtained by BuzzFeed News documents how officials... at the detention facility in Calexico were using solitary confinement as a long term “solution” for immigrants in “protective custody,” or those who need special supervision or housing due to risks to their safety.

In addition to finding 11 immigrants had been kept in solitary confinement for more than 60 days and two others for more than 300 days, inspectors said there had been no documented review to evaluate the continued solitary confinement and the immigrants were not afforded recreation time for an hour a day, as required. The inspectors also said the detainees received inadequate medical checks."

See MoreInspectors also found that nearly a dozen immigrants detainees were kept in solitary confinement for more than two months.

buzzfeednews.com

DHS Inspectors Found ICE Detainees Who Were Kept In Solitary Confinement For 300 Days

Inspectors also found that nearly a dozen immigrants detainees were kept in solitary confinement for more than two months.Inspectors also found that nearly a dozen immigrants detainees were kept in solitary confinement for more than two months.

entry.title: Solidarity with hunger striking detainees in Bergen County, New...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

Solidarity with hunger striking detainees in Bergen County, New Jersey! #FreeThemAll

Gabe DaBabe

Abolish ICE protest where I was arrested for practicing my first amendment right to press- first person footage of my arrest can be seen in this video. Bergen C...ounty Correctional Facility has a new contract with ICE to detain undocumented people in inhumane conditions. In response to this some of the detainees have thrown a hunger strike to demand their immediate release- this hunger strike has lasted over 30 days and nothing has changed regarding the conditions or their release. There is no such thing as “illegal aliens” don’t let the language fool you into demonizing the true natives of this land. Don’t let political terms such as “annexed” or “treaty” fool you into believing that stripping people from their families is legal. The hypocrisy of America to deport people who come to this country for a better life is deadly and shameful.

See More

entry.title: Content warning: body cam footage from the night Elijah was...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

Content warning: body cam footage from the night Elijah was murdered

The case of Elijah McClain’s murder by Aurora Police and paramedics was on 60 Minutes last night and the cop excuse of "Excited Delirium”: was exposed as the latest pseudoscientific justification for racist state terror.

"Excited delirium" was mentioned in the deaths of George Floyd and Elijah McClain, but some in the medical world are skeptical it's actually a condition. John Dickerson reports.

cbsnews.com

How a questionable syndrome, "Excited Delirium," could be protecting police officers from misconduct charges

entry.title: “With negotiations at an impasse, the contract went to a...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

“With negotiations at an impasse, the contract went to a third-party arbitrator to decide who gets what. Each side — the city government and the police Denver Police Protective Association — was to give its final offers to the decider, who would choose one or the other.

The union’s final offer, the lowest raise it would accept, was identical to the original contract — 2.8 percent. But Mayor Hancock and the council could not agree on a figure, so they submitted nothing. The arbitrator gave police the raise they asked for.”

The new contract passed 10 to 3.

denverite.com

How Denver police officers secured a nearly 3% raise even though city council didn’t want to give them one

The new contract passed 10 to 3.The new contract passed 10 to 3.

entry.title: Via Comrade Shontel Lewis - RTD Director for District B I...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

Via Comrade Shontel Lewis - RTD Director for District B

I don’t know if you all have been paying attention to the egregious actions of Governor Jared S Polis . He has rejected the science and has relied on his bias, inserting his beliefs and feelings into when and whom have access to the vaccine. He used his authority to change the recommendation.

We all know someone that is in jail, prison and/or sometime experiencing homelessness. To deny them early access to the vaccine ...is criminal but since we are talking about people that society has deem as invaluable this is acceptable. Don’t let this slide.

I know you all are busy. But can you please do me a favor and contact your State Representative and Senators.

I know it can be scary to speak truth to power — but you can and you must. We cannot accept that someone sentenced to a two year prison sentence is not only now on 24 hour lock down, but sentenced to death because they are denied early access to the vaccine.

Those are our brothers, sisters, cousins that are being forgotten about.

Your reps need to hear from you. Email and call, tell them to follow the science and not allow the personal feeling they have toward to those in prisons and jails cloud their judgment.

entry.title: #FreeThemAll In York, ICE has reported nine active cases for a...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

#FreeThemAll

In York, ICE has reported nine active cases for a total of 117, with a spike in September. Pike County Prison has eight active cases, bringing the total to 32. Cambria County Jail had 11 total reported cases, though none are active. Clinton County Correctional Facility’s mid-November outbreak has resulted in 55 total cases and 52 active infections among ICE detainees, more current cases than ICE was reporting in any of the other facilities as of Dec. 9. The data does not reflect a case reported at Berks County Residential Center, where a member of the medical staff tested positive in October and immediately resigned.

https://www.witf.org/…/demonstrators-in-york-call-for-rele…/

At a vigil outside York County Prison on Thursday evening, leaders from several groups spoke and played testimony from people who had been detained – or had loved ones detained – in the building across the parking lot.

witf.org

Demonstrators in York call for releases from immigration detention | WITF

entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

“Police and protesters collided outside the Bergen County Jail on a damp and foggy Saturday evening, capping a long day of protests in the county's largest city as demonstrators rallied for hours in support of U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement detainees on hunger strike inside the jail.”

Protesters and police clashed Saturday outside the Bergen County Jail, where three ICE detainees continued a hunger strike over jail conditions.

entry.title: The impact of ICE’s failure to adequately respond to the...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

The impact of ICE’s failure to adequately respond to the pandemic was far reaching and multilayered.

Even as COVID-19 cases have surged across the country, ICE has ramped up enforcement activities, creating a recipe for disaster for those in detention and surrounding communities.

Read Detention Watch Network's new report, Hotbeds of Infection: bit.ly/ICEHotbeds

A Detention Watch Network report blames ICE for nearly a quarter-million coronavirus cases throughout the country.

theintercept.com

ICE Mismanagement Created Coronavirus “Hotbeds of Infection” In and Around Detention Centers

A Detention Watch Network report blames ICE for nearly a quarter-million coronavirus cases throughout the country.A Detention Watch Network report blames ICE for nearly a quarter-million coronavirus cases throughout the country.

entry.title: "There’s nothing for us, no way to work, to make a...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

"There’s nothing for us, no way to work, to make a living,” he said, waiting in the bus station, his infant bawling hysterically behind him. “We’re destroyed here.”

“The conditions driving migration before the two hurricanes hit were already awful, and people were struggling with the economic insecurity of the pandemic,” Karen Spring, a Canadian activist and coordinator for the Honduras Solidarity Network, told TNH. “On top of that, people are stuck with an illegitimate government.”

After back-to-back hurricanes, hundreds of Hondurans have decided enough is enough and are heading north to the United States.

thenewhumanitarian.org

Honduran storm survivors form US-bound migrant caravan

After back-to-back hurricanes, hundreds of Hondurans have decided enough is enough and are heading north to the United States.After back-to-back hurricanes, hundreds of Hondurans have decided enough is enough and are heading north to the United States.

entry.title: This virtual concert is to commemorate Ingrid's 3rd year...
entry.content:
Abolish ICE Denver

This virtual concert is to commemorate Ingrid's 3rd year living in sanctuary. There will be different musicians from across the United States sharing their talent with us. The goal of the event is to fundraise $3,000 for the personal expenses Ingrid will have during this holiday season. A part of this money Ingrid will be donating to kids who live in the mountains of Peru where she is from and where her parents still live.

The concert will be on zoom so please register with ...this link - https://forms.gle/TiD3UDX3H6agtLKn9

You will receive the zoom link for the concert the morning of Dec. 13th. If you are unable to attend, but would still like to support Ingrid, you can donate on her GoFundMe
(https://www.gofundme.com/f/virtual-benefit-concert-for-ingr…) or send her a donation directly by Venmo at @Ingrid-Encalada
